fields.topic: View the list of classes that you are teaching
fields.description:
In the upper right hand corner you will find a menu with the 'Classes' option to the left. When you hover over this option you will see a dropdown menu providing the courses that you are instructing.

If there are no courses available in the list you are not set as the 'Instructor' for any courses this semester.

fields.topic: View the distribution of learning styles across the students in a class
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

A list of the classes you are currently teaching will be listed under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

Information about the class will be displayed in the 'Statistics' tab.

fields.topic: View a list of students in a class
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

A list of the classes you are currently teaching will be listed under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

The class roster will be displayed in the 'Roster' tab.

The class roster includes the students’ names, learning styles, and personality types. 

 If the student has not completed the 'Learning Style Assessment' or the 'Personality Type Assessment' these field will be blank.

fields.topic: Contact one or more students in a class by email
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

A list of the classes you are currently teaching will be listed under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

In the 'Roster' tab there will be a checkbox next to each student’s name.

Specify which students you want to send the email to by checking the checkboxes next to their names.

Look at the bottom of the page and click the ‘Contact’ button.

A form will be displayed containing subject and message fields.

In the ‘Subject’ field, enter the subject of the email (or modify the pre-filled in subject).

In the ‘Message’ field, enter the message text of the email (or modify the pre-filled in message).

When you are ready to send the email, click the ‘Submit’ button.

The emails will be sent to the selected students.

fields.topic: Send an Intervention notification on behalf of one or more students in a class
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

You will see a list of the classes you are currently teaching under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

In the 'Roster' tab there will be a checkbox next to each student’s name.

Specify which students you want to send an intervention for by checking the checkboxes next to their names.

Look at the upper right of the roster and click the ‘Intervene’ button.

A form will be displayed containing a list of possible reasons for intervention, a campus drop-down, and comments fields.

Check the boxes next to the reasons that apply for this intervention notification.

Using the Campus drop-down, select the campus where this class is being held.

Type the message you would like sent in the 'Comments' field.

Click the ‘Submit’ button and an intervention notification email will be sent to the appropriate personnel.

fields.topic: Send an Intervention notification on behalf of a student in a class you are not teaching
fields.description:
View the students profile by using search for student.

In the 'Current Enrollments' tab there will be a checkbox next to each course the student is enrolled in.

Specify which course you want to send an intervention for by checking the checkboxe next to the course name.

Look at the top right of the enrollments table and click the ‘Intervene’ button.

A form will be displayed containing a list of possible reasons for intervention, a campus drop-down, and comments fields.

Check the boxes next to the reasons that apply for this intervention notification.

Using the Campus drop-down, select the campus where this class is being held.

Type the message you would like sent in the 'Comments' field.

Click the ‘Submit’ button and an intervention notification email will be sent to the appropriate personnel.

fields.topic: To view a student’s profile using 'search for student'
fields.description:
It is possible to search for a student profile by the first name, last name, or email address of the student.

Look in the upper right hand corner of the page for the ‘search for student’ search box.

In the ‘search for student’ search box, type in two or more characters to search for the start of a student’s first name, last name, or email address.

A list of matching students will be displayed below the ‘search for student’ search box.

Click on the desired student.

The profile of that student will be displayed.

fields.topic: View a student’s profile using a class roster
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

A list of the classes you are currently teaching will be listed under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

In the 'Roster' tab click on the name of the student whose profile you want to view.

The profile of that student will be displayed.

 You may also click on any notification icon, beside the students name in the 'Roster', to go directly to that students 'Activity Log'.

fields.topic: View a list of classes a student is currently taking
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

To see a list of the classes a student is taking, look in the ‘Current Enrollments’ tab. (Open by default)

fields.topic: View information on a student’s learning style
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

To see a summary graph of the student’s auditory, kinesthetic, and visual scores, look in the ‘Learning Style’ tab.

fields.topic: View information on surveys a student has taken
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

To see a list of surveys a student has taken, look in the ‘Survey Results’ tab.

You will see a list of dates of when surveys were taken, along with links to view the details for each survey taken.

To view the details of a specific survey’s results, click the ‘view details’ link to the right of the desired survey’s date.

fields.topic: View information on a student’s personality type
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

To see summary graphs of the student’s different personality type scores, look in the ‘Personality Type’ tab.

fields.topic: View a list of a student’s activity
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

To see a list of the visits, interventions, notes, and contacts recorded for that student, look in the ‘Activity’ tab.

fields.topic: Log a Visit or Note for a Student as a Counselor
fields.description:
View the student’s profile.

Look in the 'Activity' tab and click the ‘Visit’ or 'Note' button.

You will see a form containing the student’s name, and several form fields.

Fill in the form fields appropriately.

When you have completed filling out the fields, click the Submit button to save the visit or note.

You will then see the visit or note in the activity tab on the student's profile.

fields.topic: Log a Note for a student as an Instructor
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Classes’ menu.

A list of the classes you are currently teaching will be listed under the ‘Classes’ menu.

Click on the desired class.

Look in the 'Roster' tab and select the students you would like to log a Note for by checking the boxes to the left of their names.

click the 'Note' button.

You will see a form containing the student’s name, and several form fields.

Fill in the form fields appropriately.

When you have completed filling out the fields, click the Submit button to save the Note.

You will then see the Note in the activity tab on the student's profile.

fields.topic: View additional details about a student
fields.description:
IMPORTANT! : Additional data must be loaded to view the 'Additional Details' tab in the profile.

View the student’s profile.

Look in the 'Additional Details' tab.

You will see a table containing the additional information that has been loaded.

fields.topic: View a list of available reports
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Reports’ menu.

A list of the types of reports you can run will be listed under the ‘Reports’ menu.

fields.topic: Generate a report of Personality Type assessment results
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Reports’ menu.

A list of the types of reports you can run will be listed under the ‘Reports’ menu.

Click on ‘Personality Type’.

A form will be displayed containing fields for start and end dates.

Fill in the ‘Start Date’ and the ‘End Date’ to specify the range of dates during which Personality Type assessments were taken.

Click the ‘Submit’ button.

A report will be generated containing results of Personality Type assessments that were taken during the specified period.

From here you should be able to open or save the .xls report file.

fields.topic: Generate a report of Learning Style assessment results
fields.description:
Look in the upper right hand corner of the page and hover over the ‘Reports’ menu.

A list of the types of reports you can run will be listed under the ‘Reports’ menu.

Click on ‘Learning Style’.

A form will be displayed containing fields for start and end dates.

Fill in the ‘Start Date’ and the ‘End Date’ to specify the range of dates during which Learning Style assessments were taken.

Click the ‘Submit’ button.

A report will be generated containing results of Learning Style assessments that were taken during the specified period.

From here you should be able to open or save the .xls report file.
